reactor.core.alloc.spec

Class RingBufferAllocatorSpec<T extends Recyclable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.core.alloc.spec.RingBufferAllocatorSpec<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Supplier<RingBufferAllocator<T>>

    public class RingBufferAllocatorSpec<T extends Recyclable>
extends Object
implements Supplier<RingBufferAllocator<T>>
    Helper class for creating a RingBufferAllocator. Provides an easy way to specify the EventFactory, EventHandler, and ExceptionHandler via Reactor abstractions of Supplier and Consumer.
    Since:
    1.1
    Author:
    Jon Brisbin

    • Constructor Summary

      RingBufferAllocatorSpec<T> allocator(Supplier<T> allocator)
      The Supplier to provide the RingBuffer with the reusable objects that are being pooled.
      RingBufferAllocatorSpec<T> errorHandler(Consumer<Throwable> errorHandler)
      The Consumer to be invoked when an error occurs.
      RingBufferAllocatorSpec<T> eventHandler(Consumer<Reference<T>> eventHandler)
      The Consumer to be invoked with a sequence ID is published.
      RingBufferAllocatorSpec<T> eventThreads(int eventThreads)
      Specify the number of threads the underlying com.lmax.disruptor.RingBuffer will use.
      RingBufferAllocatorSpec<T> executor(ExecutorService executor)
      The ExecutorService to use inside the com.lmax.disruptor.RingBuffer.

      Get an object.

      Name of the RingBufferAllocator.

      Specify single or multi-threaded producer.
      RingBufferAllocatorSpec<T> ringSize(int ringSize)
      Size of the RingBuffer ring.
      RingBufferAllocatorSpec<T> waitStrategy(reactor.jarjar.com.lmax.disruptor.WaitStrategy waitStrategy)
      Specify the com.lmax.disruptor.WaitStrategy to use (defaults to com.lmax.disruptor.BlockingWaitStrategy).
